fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Two projects can share the same name. A project can also be named exactly like the key of another project. 
This breaks JQL searches and returns misleading results. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add conditions so that: 
* Project names are unique (no duplicate project names)
* Project names should not be equal to any existing project keys

h3. Workaround
Rename the project
fields.summary: Project names should be unique and not equal to any existing project key

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA is only able to order the comments as a whole based on the timestamps (Ascending/Descending). It is not possible to individually change the comment order.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to be able to change the comments order individually. For example, users should be able to change the comment order of the 5th comment to the 2nd position.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Ability to individually order the comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

During a Zero Downtime Upgrade, all the nodes were reset during the upgrade.

This left the nodes unable to complete the upgrade tasks and they could not progress from {{running_upgrade_task}} in the {{CLUSTEREDUPDATESTATE}}

Due to this, the nodes were never able to successfully run the upgrade tasks and the ZDU update page showed the nodes as "Running Upgrade Tasks" despite not running those upgrade tasks
h3. Suggested Resolution

Upon startup, if the last ID in the {{CLUSTERUPDATESTATE}} equals Running Upgrade Tasks, check to see if upgrade tasks need to be run. 

Otherwise, revert back to {{Ready to run upgrade Tasks}}. This will allow Admins to manually change to {{Running Upgrade Tasks}} which will allow the upgrade tasks to be manually started. 
h3. Why this is important

If nodes are not allowed to complete the upgrade tasks and transition from {{Running Upgrade Tasks to Stable then}} the upgrade will never be allowed to be finalized.

In addition, while nodes are in the status of {{Running Upgrade Tasks}} the upgrade cannot be canceled.
h3. Workaround

 If nodes have been rebooted and startup with the status of {{Running Upgrade Tasks}} in the {{CLUSTERUPGRADESTATE}}

You can remove the entry and make sure the highest ID is {{READY TO RUN UPGRADE TASKS}} this will allow you to revert back to be allowed to run "Finalizing Upgrade Tasks" which should then restart into {{RUNNING UPGRADE TASKS}} and then complete the upgrade tasks successfully.
fields.summary: On Startup if CLUSTERUPDATESTATE = Running_Upgrade_Task, recheck if upgrade tasks need to be run

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When upgrading Jira, certain upgrade tasks can take a long time to complete. The task below recently took an hour to complete which caused concern as we were unsure that it was still running. 

{{plugin.devstatus.upgrade.UpgradeTaskBuild03: Migrating rows}}
h3. Suggest Solution

Please add batching of the migrated rows so admins can better follow the progress of this upgrade task. 
h3. Why this is important

It would provide admins with the reassurance that the upgrade task was still running.
fields.summary: As an admin, please add batching to UpgradeTaskBuild03:Migrating Rows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 - Update project role actors functionality is vulnerable to race condition.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to "Project" -> "Settings" -> "Users and Roles" menu
 # Trigger multiple "Add users to a role", "Remove user from a role" actions interchangeably on the same project role.

h3. Expected Results

All actions are executed successfully and the resulting project role actors state expresses the sum of completed operations.
h3. Actual Results

Some executed operations are overridden by other threads and not present in the final result e.g. users still assigned to specific project role despite triggering an action to remove them.
h3. Workaround

Execute project role actor updates synchronously.
fields.summary: Race condition when updating actors to project role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the language is set to Russian in user profile, user is unable to log work with the error 'Specify the date of work completion.'
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to user profile.
 # Under 'Preferences', click on the pencil icon to edit. Set the Language to 'Russian'.
 # Head to any issue and click on *More > Log Work*.
 # Fill in the details in the *log Work* page.

h3. Expected Results

User will be able to successfully log work.
h3. Actual Results

User will not able to log work with the error 'Specify the date of work completion.' (Należy podać datę wykonania pracy.)

 
h3. Workaround

As for now, set the global language to Russian, then set it back to English. Then, the log work feature will work successfully.
fields.summary: When the language is set to Russian in user profile, user is unable to log work with the error 'Specify the date of work completion.'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the URL to a LDAP directory contains any "unsupported symbol", the health check for LDAP directories will fail with 'IllegalArgumentException: hostname can't be null'. This is because the URI library only supports hostnames with alphanumeric characters or the hyphen symbol.

See JavaDocs for the library indicating this [here|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/net/URI.html#getHost--].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Jira to a LDAP directory with a URL like {{ldap.domain.com}} after that, change the URL/Hostname to one containing a symbol other than hyphen - e.g. an underscore, as in {{ldap_server.domain.com}};
# Eventually, you'll get the following error message in Jira's logs:
{noformat}
2019-05-15 12:34:54,923 HealthCheck:thread-8 ERROR ServiceRunner [c.a.t.j.healthcheck.support.AbstractSupportHealthCheck] Unhandled error during healthcheck
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: hostname can't be null
    at java.net.InetSocketAddress.checkHost(InetSocketAddress.java:149)
    at java.net.InetSocketAddress.<init>(InetSocketAddress.java:216)
    at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.healthcheck.directory.LdapUrlParser.getLdapInetSocketAddress(LdapUrlParser.java:44)
    at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.healthcheck.directory.LdapUrlParser.getLdapInetSocketAddress(LdapUrlParser.java:61)
    at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.healthcheck.directory.LdapAuthenticationHealthCheck.lambda$doCheck$1(LdapAuthenticationHealthCheck.java:71)
    at java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1249)
    at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.healthcheck.directory.LdapAuthenticationHealthCheck.doCheck(LdapAuthenticationHealthCheck.java:66)
    at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.healthcheck.support.AbstractSupportHealthCheck.check(AbstractSupportHealthCheck.java:23)
    at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.healthcheck.impl.PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.check(PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.java:49)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Considering URLs may contain a number of different symbols, including the underscore mentioned in the example above, the check shouldn't fail.

h3. Actual Results
Hostnames with "unsupported" symbols will cause the check to fail.

h3. Workaround
There are a couple of options:
# Ignore the error entirely - it doesn't affect any functionality
# Use URLs with no "unsupported" symbols for configuring LDAP directories
# Use the IP address or an alternate hostname for the affected LDAP directory
fields.summary: LDAP directories with URL containing "unsupported symbol" leads to unhandled error in health check

fields.description:
First the new look in the customfields admin page from 7.9.2 to 8.1 took me by surprise. I like that I can search for a customfield or a field associated to a projet.

What I don't like at all is the case where you want to find all the customfields linked to a perticular issuetype: it is impossible now to find them. I don't want to have to open ALL the link in this page to see if a field is linked. It is time consuming the way you did it. 

We have been using Jira for 12 years and there is a lot of legacy and with 900 customfields it will become more complicated and sooo long to find all those customfield. 

If you continue with this way of displaying this page, you MUST find a way to let us find customfield related to a specific issuetype. 

The way it works in 8.1, I will have to use SQL to do my work. I am disapointed in this part of the new JIRA. If you correct this it will be at least one year before my work will be made better.
fields.summary: The new customfields admin page is missing fonctionnalities

fields.description:
If Jira Administrators follow the steps of [JRASERVER-65521|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65521] and set the {{public.access.disabled}} to the Dark Features, when an users gets to {{https://JIRA-BASE-URL/secure/Dashboard.jspa}}, they are successfully redirected to SAML login and get a session. But if they try using:
{code}
https://JIRA-BASE-URL/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10101
{code}

Then instead of being redirected to SAML and getting back to the dashboard, the users are presented with an error in Jira:

!Screen Shot 2019-05-17 at 15.27.34.png|thumbnail!

It would be good if instead of this, users were just authenticated and able to see the Dashboard.
fields.summary: Redirect all Dashboards to SSO Login

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Next issue key number is determined from *pcounter* database column located in project database table. If one wants to override next issue key value, the value needs to be modified directly through the database.

h3. Suggested resolution
We suggest implementing REST API method to retrieve and modify current value for pcounter.
fields.summary: REST API interface to modify pcounter (issue count number)
the JQL worklogDate parameter search filter results are incorrect while using it in combination with NOT operator.

fields.description:
Now I found this REST API in Jira cloud version:

[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-filter-get]

Would it possible to be available on Jira server version? It is really useful for us. 

Or please advise whether there is a workaround to use REST API to get all permitted filters by user.

 

Thanks a lot!
fields.summary: REST API: Get all permitted filters by user

fields.description:
In previous Jira versions, you could search in Quick search for text with special characters in, because an escape \ was always added into the search.
 This doesn’t apply to Jira 8.x. 
 For example, while searching for a text in summary with special characters in, you have to add manually the \ char into the search.
 Else the issue is not found.

As per [escapingSpecialcharacters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/search-syntax-for-text-fields-939937723.html#Searchsyntaxfortextfields-escapingSpecialcharacters]:

*Special characters*
 + - & | ! ( ) \{ } [ ] ^ ~ * ? \ :
 Special characters aren’t stored in the index, which means you can’t search for them. The index only keeps text and numbers, so searching for "
[Jira Software
]" and "Jira Software" will have the same effect — escaped special characters ([]) won’t be included in the search.

In previous Jira versions, you could use special characters to combine two separate terms into a phrase, for example "Jira+Software" or "Jira/Software".
fields.summary: Add escaping characters for special chars in quick search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html] page, it is stated that the supported database for Oracle is Oracle 12c R1 with the 12.2.0.1 driver. 

When heading to the 'Plan your Upgrade' page, the 'You're using an unsupported database' is shown even when the supported Oracle database is being used.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to *System > Applications > Plan your upgrade*.
 # Click on 'Complete pre-upgrade checks'.

h3. Expected Results

As the database is supported, there should be no warning thrown in 'Complete pre-upgrade checks'.
h3. Actual Results

The warning 'You're using an unsupported database.' is shown even when the supported Oracle database is used.

!plan your upgrade.PNG!
h3. Workaround

Proceed to upgrade the instance as the correct database is being used anyways.
fields.summary: 'Plan your Upgrade' page gives a warning 'You're using an unsupported database' when using Oracle 12c R1 as a database.

fields.description:
In the backlog it is possible via right mouse click to move a user story to the top or the bottom of the backlog  this is very convenient since dragging the stories is not that fast. 
It would be great if this would be also possible in a sprint, but than move a user story to the top or bottom of that specific sprint backlog (so not to normal backlog). 
So for example a function: "move to top or bottom of this sprint"
fields.summary: Functionality to move stories to top or bottom of a specific sprint (e.g. via right mouse click, just as in backlog)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In situations where the number of "expensive" JQLs identified by the *Atlassian Diagnostics* plugin is high enough, Jira might end up running out of memory due to the number of objects stored in the heap.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

TBD

h3. Expected Results
Non-optimized JQLs will be stored in the database.

h3. Actual Results
JQLs that generated an alert in the plugin will pile in the heap causing constant full GC cycles and OOM errors.

h3. Workaround

We can increase the threshold of the alerts based on the query time with the following JVM argument:
{code}
jira.diagnostics.thresholds.slow-query-millis=4000
{code}
* Note that the default value for this parameter is 400.

Alternatively, we can disable the *Atlassian Diagnostics* plugin through the *Manage Apps* page - this plugin will be found in the *System Add-ons* section.
fields.summary: Atlassian Jira Diagnostics plugin may cause an OutOfMemory error

fields.description: Bloomberg recently upgrade to the latest enterprise release of Jira and migrated to Data Center.  As part of the migration, Bloomberg had challenges merging information from the Big Picture App.  While it is understood that the challenge is on the vendor they would like the marketplace to somehow detail if apps are 'certified' for migration to data center (rather than just it works as a fresh install with Data center).  This would help them better plan migrations and the effort involved.
fields.summary: Any way to track if a marketplace app has been certified for migration to DC

fields.description:
Use Case:

As an administrator I would like to see some capacity or load value for each node. This would be the available capacity or the used capacity on that node.

I would like this value to be available so that it can be used in real time to determine the load on each individual node. 
* This could be used in a load balancer to direct traffic to nodes with available capacity
* This could be used in external integrations that retrieve data from JIRA. The external integration could check for available capacity prior to making requests.
fields.summary: Individual nodes report used or available capacity value

fields.description:
Can https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/archiving-a-project-938847621.html
please be updated to include information with respect to Confluence?

Had a client ask me:

if a user has a link to a JIRA issue in an archived project, they will still be able to view the issue right?

so if a JIRA issue is displayed on a confluence page, it will still show?

I know that Confluence looks at the Jira index to pull out this information, but it would be helpful to update this information for all customers who have Jira DC and Confluence.

*Don't #@!% the customer.*

Cheers.
fields.summary: Update documentation for Jira Archiving a project

fields.description:
Hi,

 

We have on-premise JIRA Software 7.1.10 (SEN-7354052). We are evaluating options to migrate content on updated Jira on Azure cloud, as we are not sure if all features and product available in Azure cloud we are looking for your suggestion/recommendation for migration.
fields.summary: Jira migration to Azure cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When Jira user restores XML backup, the latest step that is being executed is re-indexing of the restored data, which appears when procedure reaches 90%. In many situation, re-indexing can take hours to finish and sometimes, the percentage gets frozen at 96% for some time.

As users don't have information that the re-indexing is going on in the background, they may get impression that something is wrong and the application got stuck, which is likely the case - the procedure will finish and reach 100% at some point.

h3. Suggested resolution
Improve documentation article so that it includes this information as mentioned above.
fields.summary: Improve "Restoring data from an xml backup" to reflect information on re-indexing during restoration

fields.description:
As a Microsoft Partner, our company gets free access to TFS / Azure DevOps and use it for source code management, builds and deployments. We've been using Jira server for quite a long time but never quite integrated TFS data into Jira Issues the way it should (ie just like Bitbucket and Bamboo do):

!image-2019-05-15-10-29-46-840.png|width=237,height=204!

Upon reading [this article|[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/6-integrations-every-Jira-Software-Cloud-team-NEEDS-to-know/ba-p/1069040]] and looking at the Rest API for Jira Cloud, it seems it would be feasible to do just that. Unfortunately, the following API are only available for Jira Cloud:
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Development-Information]
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Deployments]
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Builds]

We think it should also be ported / made available in Jira Server as well to enable custom integration.
fields.summary: Add REST endpoint to manage Issue Dev Details (git repo, deployment and build data) like Jira Cloud

fields.description:
Currently, an existing AD user would be deleted from Jira if:
* An AD synchronization happens where the user is outside of scope.
* And if the user is not an assignee or reporter on any Jira issue.

However, if the user is an assignee or a reporter on any issue, then the user would only be de-activated.

*Suggestion*
We have a use case where we do not want the user to be deleted if there is logged work associated with the user. Instead, de-activate the user.
fields.summary: Do not remove users if there is Work Log data associated with the user.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira by default, there is an existing custom field named 'Root cause' with the custom field type 'Multi Line (Text)'. When using this custom field in Advanced Searching, the syntax should be : 

!bundled jira Root cause field.png!

However, when a custom field is created with the name similar to 'Root cause', the search syntax in Advanced Searching will follow the syntax of the bundled custom field 'Root cause'. 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field called 'Root Cause' with the custom field type 'Select List (single choice)'.
 # Head to Issue Navigator and perform a search for the custom field 'Root Cause' with the JQL Query : 

{code:java}
 project = "test" AND "Root Cause" = "Unknown"{code}
h3. Expected Results

When the new custom field 'Root Cause' is selected, the syntax should show :
 !expected root cause.PNG!
 And the search should be successful.

!expected search.PNG!
h3. Actual Results

The syntax shown will be for the custom field 'Root cause' instead.

!New Root cause syntax.PNG!

And the search for the correct syntax will not be successful.

!error.PNG!

 
h3. Workaround

Rename the 'Root cause' field if you are not using it or perform a search using the ID instead.

!root-cause-same-name.jpg!
fields.summary: When a custom field is created with the name similar to 'Root cause', the search syntax in Advanced Searching will follow the syntax of the bundled custom field 'Root cause'.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Basic issue search retain custom field value which is applied to a specific project after switching to a project which doesn't have it in the context
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom Field
 # Set the context of the custom field to one project
 # Create an issue on the project which has the field in the context and fill the field
 # From basic issue search filter the project **which has the field in the context and also filter the custom field.
 # Issue with the field in are shown
 # Then remove the filter from the project which has the field in the context and switch to another one which doesn't have the field in the context.
 # No issue are shown for that project
 # Observe that it is impossible to remove the flag from the custom field from *More*
 # **Switch to Advanced issue search and look at the JQL which still contains the custom field

I'm attaching a screen recording which explain better the weird behaviour:

[Basic search broken by custom field with context |https://transfer.atlassian.com/link?key=GHS-151863%2FScreen+Recording+basic+search+broken+by+custom+field+with+context_2019-05-15T12%3A03%3A38.557.mov]
h3. Expected Results

After switching to a project which doesn't have the field in the context, the custom field should be cleared.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour.
fields.summary: Basic issue search retain custom field value which is applied to a specific project after switching to a project which doesn't have it in the context

fields.description:
In Jira server version 8.1.0, when you enable batching email notifications they are enabled across all projects and applied to all users.

Can this be made a user preference instead of a global setting.
fields.summary: Option to configure batching email notifications per user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently JVM inherits file and system encoding from the operating system, unless JVM parameters are specified

Usually this is not a problem as the operating system is configured for UTF-8, however, a slight can cause this problem.

h3. Environment

Any operating system not using UTF-8 for file or system encoding

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure OS to use Latin-1 encoding (or ISO-8859-1 or Windows-1252) instead of UTF-8
# Use a multi-byte character such as *{{è}}* (e-Grave, U+00E8)

h3. Expected Results

Character renders as *{{è}}* 

h3. Actual Results

Character renders as *{{Ã, ¨}}*

h3. Notes

We should ship the UTF-8 settings by default because there is no good reason to inherit the file/system encodings from the operating system.

https://www.i18nqa.com/debug/bug-utf-8-latin1.html
[Jira Application internationalisation and encoding troubleshooting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-application-internationalisation-and-encoding-troubleshooting-203394762.html]

h3. Workaround
Add the following [JVM parameters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-861253969.html]:

 {code}-Dfile.encoding=utf-8
-Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8{code}
fields.summary: System settings can affect how gadget text is rendered

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As for now, when you create a pie chart gadget and choose a specific project, the *Statistic Type* does not respect the project selected. This can be confusing for instances that have a lot of custom fields and for the users to choose which custom field that needs to be selected.

In the future, we should make the *Statistic Type* dynamic following the project selected.
fields.summary: The ability for the 'Statistic Type' in Pie Chart gadget to be dynamic following the project selected

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

For a sprint created in Board A to be visible in another Board B, there needs to be at least one issue in the sprint which respects the filter configured in Board B.

If the sprint is empty, it will only show in the Board where it was created, but not the other boards.

This behavior can be an issue when there are a lot of teams and a lot of stories and teams need to work on their own board. It would be nice to have empty sprints available in all backlogs so that the teams can plan their stories.
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a new setting in JIRA to allow empty sprints to be visible in any board.
fields.summary: Add a setting which will allow users to see empty Sprints in any board

fields.description:
Current Behavior: 
 * Changes to the announcement banner are not recorded in the audit log.

Desired Behavior:
 * Record changes to the announcement banner in audit log. Show before and after like what shows when a user is renamed.
fields.summary: Track announcement banner changes in audit log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Web links are not exported

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket
# Navigate to _More > Link_
# Select "Web Link"
# Add an URL and a link text
# Click on "Link"
# Select _Export > XML_ (or any format)

h3. Expected Results
The web link included should be exported

h3. Actual Results
The web links are not getting exported in any export format (XML, Word or Printable)

h3. Workaround

Use the following REST API call to get the web link information from a ticket:

{{http://JIRA_URL/rest/api/latest/issue/SCRUM-8/remotelink}}
fields.summary: Web links are not exported

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72033].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

When working in Jira, a project avatar is one common way that admins will customize to help users quickly sort through to identify what project they are working in. When you then have to switch applications to Confluence or alike, there is no means to automatically use the same custom avatar icon for that linked space. This can cause confusion or delays until users can be sure they are working in the correct space/project
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be awesome if when you link a Jira Project to a Confluence space, if Jira would prompt you to sync the avatar between these two. Granted, it would be understood that the user creating this link would need to have admin rights in both applications likely, and there might be a question of which avatar to use when initiating the sync. However to be able to do this automatically for admins would be really helpful in making it very clear to end users which content is linked to what other content.
h3. Note:

This suggestion does not seek to sync avatars of user objects.  Just that between spaces and projects.
fields.summary: When linking a Jira Project to a Confluence Space, there should be a quick option to sync the avatar between project and space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When I have batched email notifications enabled, Issue Created notifications are included in the batched notification instead of sending a separate notification.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable [batching notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-email-notifications-938847633.html#Configuringemailnotifications-batching]
 # Have a notification scheme that will alert you when a new issue is created in a given project
 # Create a new issue in that project
 # Make some changes to issue fields

h3. Expected Results

Per the documentation on [configuring email notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-email-notifications-938847633.html#Configuringemailnotifications-batching], I expect:
 * I immediately receive an email notification alerting me that a new issue has been created.
 * Up to 10 minutes later, I get a second email notifying me of changes to issue fields/status/etc.

h3. Actual Results

I do not receive an email notification immediately. Instead, I receive one email within 10 minutes notifying me that the issue was created and of my changes.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Enabling batched notifications causes "Issue Created" notifications to be batched instead of sent immediately

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If capital {{NOT}} is used inside a string when searching for issues, Jira will fail to match any issues to this search. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue that contains the word {{not}} in the summary.
# Go into the issue navigator and search this issue with the following JQL:
{code}
summary ~ "this is NOT a summary"
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Issues that match the query will be returned on this search.

h3. Actual Results

No issues are returned from this query.

h3. Workaround

Adjusting the JQL and replacing {{NOT}} with {{not}} will ensure that the query works as expected.
fields.summary: Using capital NOT inside a string on a JQL will cause Jira to not match any issues to the search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When transitioning an issue that contains a screen, the action called is "CommentAssignIssue".  This can be misleading when we have to investigate user activity, such as identifying slow actions, etc.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workflow transition with a screen
 # Perform the workflow transition in a ticket

h3. Expected Results
When checking the requests, either via access_log or another method, we expect to see something like: {{TransitionIssue.jspa}}

h3. Actual Results
Instead we see see that the Jira request: {{CommentAssignIssue.jspa}}
fields.summary: Rename CommentAssignIssue to TransitionIssue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a large site tile, the menu items are not lining up with selected menu item

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to "Look and feel" (_Administration > System > Look and feel_)
# Check the option "Show Site Tile"
# Navigate to the "General configuration" menu (_Administration > System > General configuration)
# Add a long site tile
# Check the menu header
 !sup_navigation.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Jira should keep the alignment

h3. Actual Results
Jira is not lining up the menu items with the selected menu

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When adding a long site title, the menu items are not lining up with selected menu item

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Cannot set Security Level value on sub-task when the field is hidden. This applies when using custom add-on to explicitly set the field value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Security Level with the project
# Hide Security Level field on all screens and hide it in Field configuration
# Utilize custom add-on to set the Security Field value when the sub-task gets created

h3. Expected Results
After the sub-task gets created, the field value is set.

h3. Actual Results
After sub-task gets created, although the add-on is configured to set the value, the value is not set, but it is empty.

h3. Notes
* This does not occur with some other tested system fields (like Due Date).
* *When a user hides Security Level field on the parent ticket, custom add-on is able to set a value, although the field is completely hidden. Here we can see difference in behaviour between sub-task and other issue types.*
* The behaviour was tested with Automation Lite and Copy and Sync add-ons

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot set Security Level value on sub-task when the field is hidden

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When inserting line breaks (i.e.: "//") to control line spacing in Jira Visual Editing Mode, in Jira Service Desk Queue Page, visual editor gets broken.

h3. Environment
Jira Version : Tested on Jira SD 4.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA Service Desk Project.
# Click on *Queues* to show all open issue.
# Click on any issue to open it. (The Queues should show at your left hand side)
# Insert a line break (i.e.: "//"), a table and other hmtl macro formatting in visual view editing mode.
# Add in the Comment.
# It will show broken line breaks, additional line breaks and broken tables.
# Issue will not happen if we are using text editing mode or open the issue without queues at your left hand side.

h3. Expected Results
Formatting should be show correctly.

h3. Workaround
Use text editing mode while inserting this formatting.
fields.summary: When inserting line breaks (i.e.: "//") to control line spacing in Jira Visual Editing Mode, in Jira Service Desk Queue Page, visual editor gets broken.
HTML specification for Favicons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an event in Confluence Team Calendar, the custom date fields in JIRA are not showing. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 8.0 onwards
Confluence 6.12.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an application link between JIRA and Confluence and ensure that the OAuth token is generated in both apps. 
# Create a custom date picker field in JIRA and add it in a screen.
# Create an issue in JIRA and fill up values in the custom date picker field from Step 2. 
# Navigate to Confluence's Team calendar and left click on any date.
# Select the JIRA project where the custom date picker field is configured

h3. Expected Results
The custom date picket field should show on the fields section
!792.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Only the default date fields are there.
!800.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
It used to work in JIRA 7.9.2 but not in JIRA 8 onwards. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JIRA dates don't show in Confluence Team Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Fixing error on Integrity Checker is saying "No errors were corrected" when it actually fixed something. This is a misleading message because the errors are actually fixed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run Integrity Checker.
# If there is an error being flagged out, hit the Fix button.

h3. Expected Results
Integrity Checker to fix all the errors and report back to the user saying that all the errors have been corrected.

h3. Actual Results
Integrity Checker fixes all the errors and reporting to the user that "No errors were corrected".
!integrity-checker.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Fixing error on Integrity Checker is saying No error were corrected when it actually fixed something

fields.description:
Had a recent call with Bloomberg who are in process of upgrading to 7.13.  Couple of pieces of feedback on the 'Sprint Goals' field that their user community provided that I thought I'd share:

1/ They asked if there was any plans to expand the sprint goals field to be more than a single line?  In the past, they have create a ticket per sprint with a series of bullet points.  The are having to now list out the goals separated by '|' for groups wishing to use the functionality.  Thus, they would like the sprint goals to be multi-line

2/ Can sprint goals be searchable?  They'd like to identify common goals across multiple sprints.

 

I understand these request may be more 'Jira Align/Portfolio' but I was asked to raise them.
fields.summary: Bloomberg - Feedback on Sprint Goals

fields.description: Would be helpful if a Label could have a visibility level set similar to Comments.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict label visibility
Adding a comment to an issue via the update issue API endpoint sends wrong transition in webhook data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When implementing SAML either through JDC or through a vendor plugin, the net result is you have to turn off websudo because you can't get websudo and SAML to work. The effect is you can go straight into administration functions without confirmation that you should. This poses a security risk. 

h3. Suggested Solution
I am requesting an enhancement to allow websudo to work with both your JDC SAML setup as well as to allow websudo to work with other marketplace SAML plugins.
fields.summary: Ability to have the Websudo functionality working with SAML / SSO

fields.description:
While the re-indexing progress bar does show when the re-indexing step itself is being done, there isn't similar visibility around operations that are DC-specific. Things like snapshot creation, compression, and distribution are not accounted for.

These other events should be shown as well when they're underway.
fields.summary: DC Re-indexing progress & events aren't fully conveyed by the UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently, after creating project from sample data (Projects > Create project > Create sample data > select Project management template) on instance with German language, Workflow names include non-ASCII characters (hyphen):
 !image-2019-05-09-10-36-08-885.png|thumbnail!  
However, as per JRASERVER-41875, manually created workflows can't be named by using non-ASCII characters.

This makes confusion when copying workflow, as user gets message "Please use only ASCII characters", if name of copied workflow still refers a hyphen.

h3. Suggested  resolution
Change workflow naming for worklows created from templates, so they don't include non-ASCII characters.
fields.summary: After creating project from sample data on instance with German language, Workflow names include non-ASCII characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As per JRASERVER-34746, the {{/rest/api/2/issue/<issueKey>/worklog}} does not support pagination or ordering

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue that has a reasonable number of worklogs
# Attempt to request the worklog endpoint, using the {{startAt}}, {{maxResults}}, {{total}} or {{orderBy}} to filter the results. For example, {{http://localhost:8080/rest/2/api/issue/TEST-1/worklog?maxResults=10}}.

h3. Expected Results
The rest endpoint returns the results in line with the parameters specified in the URL. In the example given, only 10 results should be returned (and the value should be reflected in the JSON output).

h3. Actual Results
The rest endpoint returns all results, from oldest to newest. The {{maxResults}} value in this example would show all worklogs for that issue.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time. Additional processing must be done by the REST consumer to manipulate the results for an issue's worklogs.
fields.summary: The /rest/api/2/issue/<issueKey>/worklog endpoint does not support pagination or ordering

fields.description:
In History Tab only the last value added for "component" is recorded and the previous values are ignored
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Create 2 components(eg.comp1 and comp2) in a project
 # Create a new issue
 # Edit issue and Add comp1 into the component field
 # Edit issue again and Add comp2 into component field

h4. Expected Behaviour

The second row history for comp2 should be:
||Original Value||New Value||
|camp1|camp1,camp2|
h4. Actual Behaviour:
||Original Value||New Value||
| |camp2|


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.

h4. Note

This seems to affect  "Component" and "Affect Version" and "Fix Version" fields.
fields.summary: Component values are not captured in History Tab properly. Only the last value added  is recorded

fields.description:
Since Jira Server 8.0 admins can switch on email notifications batching per instance. The current interval for notifications is 10 minutes and cannot be set to a different value. 

Admins should be able to configure the batching delay time because some teams cannot afford to wait 10 minutes. There are also instances where longer delay would be useful.
fields.summary: Allow admins adjust delay for email notifications batching

fields.description:
Currently, when JIRA admin sends an email from secure/admin/SendBulkMail!default.jspa , JIRA will include the current user identifying information - such as email address and name.

It will be good to have an ability to let the administrator decide whether to include the sending user details or not as otherwise it creates a risk when customers start responding directly to the administrator email, thus actual JIRA cases don't receive the updates
fields.summary: Ability not to include sending user details in "Send email" functionality in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

Since old favicons are not being used anymore, it is better for us to completely remove all icons related to the old versions to prevent it from being loaded up as the icon in web browsers in the future. The difference in icon can cause confusion for some users.
fields.summary: For newer versions of Jira, the old favicons should be removed to prevent it to be loaded up

{code}

h3.Notes
Jira will not show the invalid value when editing default values, or when you're looking at the field values at creation or editing an issue. Check the database for the defaults, with the workaround below.

h3. Workaround
For finding invalid default values, use the following SQL to identify them in the database:

{code}
SELECT customfield.id as cfid, customfield.customfieldtypekey, customfield.cfname, genericconfiguration.*
FROM customfield
JOIN fieldconfiguration ON fieldconfiguration.fieldid = 'customfield_'||customfield.id
JOIN genericconfiguration ON genericconfiguration.datakey = CAST (fieldconfiguration.id as varchar(60))
{code}

Then, you can edit the field from Jira Admin > Issues > Custom Fields > Configure (and update the field in question).

Identifying issues with an invalid stored value can be accomplished with the following SQL:
{code}
SELECT concat(p.pkey, '-', ji.issuenum), cf.cfname, cf.customfieldtypekey, cfv.stringvalue, cfv.numbervalue, cfv.textvalue, cfv.datevalue, cfv.valuetype
FROM jiraissue ji
JOIN project p ON ji.project = p.id
JOIN customfieldvalue cfv ON ji.id = cfv.issue
JOIN customfield cf ON cfv.customfield = cf.id
WHERE cf.cfname = '<Name of your custom field>'
{code}

With the issues identified, you can either update those issues via the bulk tools, REST API or database. Please note that database edits are not supported. In the event a database edit is required, please ensure you've got a full database backup, Jira is offline, and that you attempt your changes on a staging server before applying to production.
fields.summary: Creating or editing an issue with an invalid value for a custom field (or invalid default value) will produce a large stack trace in the logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to print reports like the Burndown Chart or Sprint Report using right-click > Print option in a browser (Chrome), the preview it's cutting off information when we have more than 1 page worth of it to show. This will not only affect the preview but will also cut the pages in the printed report itself.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a project with enough issues in a sprint, let's say 40 issues
 # Go to the Reports page, and select Burndown Chart. It will show the chart, and below a list of the issues in the sprint selected and it's event status.
 # Right-click on the page
 # Select option "Print"

h3. Expected Results
The print preview display all issue event status available, even if more than one page is necessary.

h3. Actual Results
The print preview is not showing all issue events available, cutting it all into one page and the rest is missing. Attached is screenshots showing this behaviour.

h3. Notes
Tested on a clean Jira Server 8.0.2

h3. Workaround
No workaround found at the moment. Please, if workaround exists, share it in the comment section of this ticket and add to the description if possible.
fields.summary: Print option in the browser will not print all information of a report even if there is more than one page worth of information to print

fields.description:
Maybe this exists, but an easy way in the Admin page to see if you're running the current version (given the Confluence vulnerability issues), or need to upgrade the server.
BTW, why isn't this "feedback" link available in Confluence? Want to provide the same feedback there!
fields.summary: Make it easier to figure out if there's an upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When looking at current documentation on upgrading Jira on [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-applications-938846936.html]

There are several methods described here.  However clicking the link for "Fallback" for either Server or Data Center simply leads to a circular link loop back to this same page.

That's a very frustrating experience for an end user trying to learn the recommended method to upgrade Jira.

 

Instead I was expecting to see details such as this page in the 073 namespace: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/upgrading-jira-applications-with-a-fallback-method-861253090.html]

 

I found a similar document for all the 7.x.x versions, but not for the 8.0. or the 8.1 namespaces.

Please update the Jira 8.0 and 8.1 namespaces to have a corresponding 'Fallback method' upgrade page.

 
h3. Workaround

Use 
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/upgrading-jira-applications-using-a-rapid-upgrade-method-861253101.html]
fields.summary: Current Jira upgrade info does not have fallback method documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When user tries to search for issues under Sprint using following JQL, Jira produces an incorect result:

{code}
Sprint in "D.022018Mar24"
{code}


h3. Environment

* Jira 7.13.X
* Jira 8.0.X
* Jira 8.1.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Sprint named *D.022018Mar24*.
# Create another Sprint named *ID.022018Mar24*.
# Add couple of issues to each of the Sprints.
# Go to Issue Navigator and search for the issues in Sprint *D.022018Mar24* using the following JQL:
{code}
Sprint in "D.022018Mar24"
{code}


h3. Expected Results

* Jira will show issues from Sprint *D.022018Mar24*.


h3. Actual Results

* Jira will show issues from Sprint *D.022018Mar24* & *ID.022018Mar24*.


h3. Notes

Tried to reproduce the problem with different fields but unable to replicate it so far. Problem is reproducible with *=* in JQL as well.


h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: JQL displays incorrect result of search

{code}
Also the below could be seen in the logs:
{code:java}
2019-01-1 12:35:00,166 http-nio-8080-exec-1 DEBUG user2 111x11111x2 1111aab xx.xx.xx.xx,xx.xx.xx.xx /secure/admin/jira/IndexAdmin.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.IndexConsistencyUtils] isIndexConsistent: Issue: expectedCount=235000; actualCount=159000
2019-01-1 12:35:00,166 http-nio-8080-exec-1 WARN user2 111x11111x2 1111aab xx.xx.xx.xx,xx.xx.xx.xx /secure/admin/jira/IndexAdmin.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.IndexConsistencyUtils] Index consistency check failed for index 'Issue': expectedCount=235000; actualCount=159000
As can be seen the Index is having a big discrepancy from the number of issues got from the database (expectedCount). 
{code}
h3. Environment
 * Jira Datacenter 7.10.x or later
 * Having 1 or more projects in Archive.
** Unsure if you have Archived projects? See [List of Archived Projects from Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/list-of-archived-projects-from-database-976763219.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce

No known steps to reproduce this issue so far.
h3. Expected Results

Re-Indexing should finish at 100% and Jira should report the right number of issues responding to the call:
{code:java}
GET <JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/api/2/index/summary
{code}
h3. Actual Results
 * Jira reports wrong progress while doing Re-Indexing
 * and the above call shows zero issues in archive (_"countInArchive": 0_) which is wrong:
{code:java}
{
  "indexReadable": true,
  "countInDatabase": 235000,
  "countInIndex": 159000,
  "countInArchive": 0,
  "lastUpdatedInDatabase": "2019-01-1T00:40:00.357+0100",
  "lastUpdatedInIndex": "2019-01-1T12:35:00.000+0100"
}
{code}

h3. Workaround

The workaround for this issue is simple, we need to correct the values of the cache by flushing it and rebuilding the number.
 This can be done by adding or removing a project.

Please follow the below steps:
 # As a workaround to clear the cache, create a new empty project, an issue on that project, then archive the project.
 # verify if countInArchive has changed in */rest/api/2/index/summary* response.

The above issue is also described in the KB: [ReIndexing reporting wrong numbers on Jira Datacenter with Archived Projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/ReIndexing+reporting+wrong+numbers+on+Jira+Datacenter+with+Archived+projects].
fields.summary: ReIndexing reporting wrong numbers on Jira Datacenter with Archived projects

As a user, I would prefer to see the correct spelling of the city name (Kyiv, not Kiev) when I selecting user profile timezone.

Here is the link to the official information from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine [https://mfa.gov.ua/en/page/open/id/5418]

#KyivNotKiev

fields.description: Based on the following [Backing Up Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/backing-up-data-938847673.html] , kindly assist to add steps to backup $JIRA_HOME/logos. This is to indicate user's to backup them before migration/upgrade, if they are using their own logo.
fields.summary: To add backup $JIRA_HOME/logos for user uploaded logos during upgrade/migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Custom Field with the following description:
{code:html| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#F4F5F7 |bgColor=#F4F5F7}
<script type="text/javascript">
  alert("Javascript in Custom Field");
</script>
{code}
# Add it to all screens.
# Edit the issue and add a value to the custom field.
# Reload the page

h3. Expected
The JavaScript would be executed on page load, and the user would receive an alert in the browser.

h3. Actual
The JavaScript is not executed, unless the custom field is edited (through inline editing).

h3. Notes
* This happens even with the *Enable HTML in custom field descriptions and list item values* set to *ON*.

h3. Workaround
Adapt the JavaScript to add it to the *Announcement Banner* instead.
fields.summary: HTML in custom field descriptions doesn't work on the Issue View

fields.description:
Like in Confluence pages or Jira Worklog, it would be great for the admins to add a few words about what they have updated/changed when they publish a new version of a workflow.

This can then be shown as Workflow Vision History (updator, date, remark on publish).
fields.summary: Add a text field to Workflow Publish mask to protocol the changes

fields.description: For admins it would be very useful, if they know who has changed the configuration of a custom field or edited it. A field/hint of last updated and updated by would help a lot. :)
fields.summary: Show last updator of Custom Fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, to integrate JIRA Data Center with SAML, the required configuration is to have the same DC Instance connected to the same directory that the IdP is connected to. Hence, JIRA needs to be connected to the IdP and the directory at the same time. If it is not, JIRA would not be able to detect which user is currently authenticating through SAML until the user is registered.

h3. Suggested Solution
Rather than connected to both, for JIRA to only connect to IdP and automatically sync the users from it so it will be easier. This appears to be available for our Cloud service as in [ACCESS-33|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-33] which will be great if Server has it as well.
fields.summary: JIRA SAML to syncs the user from IdP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Environment
* Jira Data Center
* Azure

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow [Getting started with Jira Data Center on Azure|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/getting-started-with-jira-data-center-on-azure-938846970.html] to deploy Jira.
# Try to access Jira with the password that was configured for the administrator account.

Example of configuration: [^config.png]

h3. Expected Results
You'd be able to log in with the password set during the deployment.

h3. Actual Results
The password does not work. In the database, the users' password is set as {{$\{user.password\}}}

h3. Workaround
Follow the [Retrieving the JIRA Administrator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/retrieving-the-jira-administrator-192836.html] guide to reset the administrator's password.
fields.summary: Password is not correctly set when deploying Jira Data Center on Azure

fields.description:
A 'low bandwidth' version where functionality is retained even though it may not look very modern is needed for slower internet connections. 

This would allow users to be able to use Jira faster on slower networks.
fields.summary: Jira Basic HTML version
Archiving a release will not prevent it from showing up in JQL filters

fields.description:
Atlassian needs to add a "unit of usage" to the Add-on framework, so that each Add-on application can report the number of users per month, week and per day, and the list of users that run any add-on application.

Add-on applications are not cheap, and many times we have to decide to buy one add-on over another, based on how much money we have to spend.  And we wonder if we should renew an add-on.  We'd like to make those hard decisions using actual user data.  Why should we renew an expensive add-on application, if less than 5% of the Jira usage population regularly uses it?  Or if 90% of the user population uses an add-on application multiple times per day, that add-on app should certainly be renewed.

Atlassian prepares the framework that developers use to write and publish Add-on Applications for Jira. So I believe Atlassian could add to that framework a way for the Add-on Apps to record what they consider an instant of usage, and then record that usage to the usage area of the framework. From which Atlassian could then easily publish usage of each Add-on.

For example, when I go the "Manage apps" link, the Atlassian Add-on Framework could show the number of users using this app in the last month, week, day, or hour etc, that each application has passed back to it. For each "User-Installed apps" that is listed.
 There could also be a link that takes the user to the Application Usage Metric, that some charts that could indicate heavy usage over time of day, etc.
fields.summary: Need ability to report of number of users that use any Add-on Application

fields.description: As a System Admin that handles staging and production instances, it would be beneficial to export *certain* project configurations from one instance to the other, without also exporting issues or an entire project. This way a roadmap of functionalities can be planned and developed in parallel, changes could be deployed as they become necessary.
fields.summary: As a System Admin, I would like to export specific project configurations

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently swap is not enabled by default in Azure templates, which can lead to JVM crashes when the host server runs out of available RAM. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Enable swap by default. 

h3. Why this is important

To prevent JVM crashes due to exhausted physical RAM. 
 
h3. Workaround 

* Deploy a larger sized Azure Jira cluster
* Manually enable swap on the Azure host
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like swap enabled by default in Jira Azure templates so that I can prevent outages due to lack of physical RAM

fields.description:
We suggest implementing functionality that would give us option to choose whether the user needs to be redirected to Profile page during first login.

This would be useful for both new users and Jira administrators, as new users would be able to update their information and make sure it's correct.
fields.summary: Option to redirect user to Profile page after first login

fields.description:
Exporting the full data of what issues are archived is not the most comfortable way to find issues archived by mistake, or looking for some needed data from issues that is no longer available in search.

The in-app page with list of archived issues would help admins in such cases.
fields.summary: Browse archived issues page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is currently no native field in JIRA out-of-the-box which includes the username of the last user which updated an issue.

The unsupported add-on [Toolkit Plugin for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/5142/toolkit-plugin-for-jira] provides a field which contains this information, but the problem is that this field cannot be displayed in a column in the issue search page, therefore this add-on only partially helps.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create a new built-in field in JIRA which contains this information and which can be displayed in a column in the issue search page.
fields.summary: Create a new field which includes the last user that updated an issue, and which can be displayed in the issue search page

fields.description:

It would be great if the column can include further information of the Linked Issue such as the Status.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the Linked Issue column to include more information such as Status of the Linked Issue

None

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Autocomplete on the assignee field may not return matches although a match to the search string exists.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create more than 50 users with similar names. Example:
#* PersonA
#* PersonB
#* PersonC
#* PersonD
#* ...
#* PersonXXX
# Go to Issue View, and trigger Autocomplete by typing PersonXX

h3. Expected Results
Autocomplete returns a suggestion which is PersonXXX.

h3. Actual Results
Autocomplete returns "No Match".

h3. Notes
The problem happens because the Autocomplete REST API call to retrieve the user suggestions limits searches to 50 results as seen from the request URL below.
{code}
http://localhost:8080/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=lenard&projectKeys=TEST&issueKey=TEST-25&maxResults=50&startAt=0&_=1556885033278
{code}
Autocomplete works as expected and suggests the user if the user is within the first 50 results, sorted alphabetically. However, it returns "No Match" if the name is outside the first 50.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using Autocomplete on assignee field may not return Autocomplete matches.

fields.description:
*Background*
Atlassian Applications such as Jira and Confluence implements _pagination_ as a user interface design feature. The purpose behind pagination is also to improve on Performance whereby loading of items are limited.

*Suggestion*
Most modern graphical user interfaces are using _Built-in Interactive Search_ which can be a better way instead of _pagination_. A search function would be able to return accurate results quicker instead of having the person to click on pages based on "guesses" on where the items are. 

If _pagination_ is still the way to go, then at least implement a global setting which defines the maximum number of entries one sees per page.

P.S: This might be a good source of reading, https://www.nngroup.com/articles/item-list-view-all/
fields.summary: Built-in Interactive Search instead of Pagination

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating issues via HTML links, the default value for custom field (Text field(multi-field line)) is not set
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with the type 'Text Field - Multi-line' and add a Default value to it. Add it to the Create/Edit/View screen of the issue.
 # Then, [create an issue via link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/creating-issues-via-direct-html-links-159474.html].

h3. Expected Results

The Default value is added to the custom field in the Create Issue screen.
h3. Actual Results

The Default value is missing in the custom field in the Create Issue screen.
h3. Workaround

Create issue manually for projects that have default value set in it.
fields.summary: When creating issues via HTML links, the default value for custom field (Text field(multi-field line)) is not set

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
*Documentation Bug: [Migrating Jira applications to another server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-jira-applications-to-another-server-938846962.html]*

Please revise and clarify important data import steps from all versions of the article:
h3.Details
From the two newest versions of _Migrating Jira applications..._ (Jira 8.0-8.1):

Within the section *Start Jira for the first time*, steps 4 and 5 ("Select My own database"..."") make it unclear that they are actually separate screens in the setup wizard/installation process. Additionally, the link "Import your data" is not very prominent on that second screen of the setup wizard, and the fact that it's a link (not a button), leads one to believe it's a link to our online KB and not a functional step in the process. (And other links in the Setup Wizard process redirect to online KB articles)

For pre-Jira 8.0 versions of the article: 

e.g. [Migrating Jira applications to another server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-jira-applications-to-another-server-938846962.html], the relevant section is 
*4. Start Jira and connect it to the database*, the same steps are number list items 3 and 4.
fields.summary: Data import verbiage from Migrating Jira Applications documentation are confusing

fields.description:
Hi,

We need a SQL query for check *workflow current step entries*, like this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-run-the-workflow-integrity-checks-in-sql-658179102.html.

Could you update the previous page with a SQL query for this check?

Thank you.
fields.summary: SQL query to check workflow current step entries in Integrity Checker

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a Jira Core/Software Projects, when adding an attachment(s) in a comment (using the 'text' editor) the file is not being attached at the cursor position, instead it's being attached at the beginning of the comment.
h3. Environment

Jira Server Core (Software & JSD Projects)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Single Attachment:
 # Go to write a comment on a JIRA Core project issue.
 # Tag someone at the beginning and write a sentence
 # Hit spacebar and insert a file (for example a .txt file)
 # Look a the location where it was inserted. (directly after the tag)

Multiple Attachments:
 # Upload multiple attachments to the issue.
 # Type text into the comment box, using the 'Text' editor.
 # Insert attachment (attached at the cursor position, expected results).
 # Insert another attachment (attached to the beginning of the issue, not expected).

h3. Expected Results

!image-2019-05-02-16-42-59-488.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

!actual result.PNG|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JIRA Pie Chart does not display values from Tempo's Account field correctly

h3. Environment
JIRA 8.1
Tempo 10.2.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an account in Tempo Account configuration, link it to a project
 # Open any issue from the project and set a value for the account field
 # Add a pie chart with a filter/project that includes the issue above and select the Account field as "Statistic Type"

h3. Expected Results
Accounts are listed correctly (in 7.x)
 !image-2019-05-02-12-01-32-034.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
Accounts are not listed, instead all the issues are grouped under "none"
 !image-2019-05-02-12-03-28-021.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This works fine in JIRA 7.x, with latest compatible Tempo version 9.4.2

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: JIRA Pie Chart does not display values from Tempo's Account field correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Only the top hierarchical value of a cascading choice custom field is imported when [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939937906.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Log in as a user with Bulk Change and Create Issue global permissions
# Have an issue import with cascading choice custom field values specified in the format described in the above KB (eg, {{"foo -> bar"}})
# Follow the steps in the above KB to import the issues 

*Expected:* Issues are created with cascading choice custom field values of "foo" and "bar".

*Actual:* Only the first-level value of "foo" is imported. No validation errors or warnings are thrown.

h3. Workaround

Use the Admin import instead, as described in [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html].

h3. Notes 

[JRASERVER-68758 - Documentation fix for Import Issues from CSV|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68758] indicates that this is a problem with the documentation, not with the functionality available.
fields.summary: Cascading choice custom field values are not imported when Creating issues using the CSV Importer

fields.description:

Go to Jira > Manage apps.  UPM shows update available but the version listed as newer is 3.0.3 whereas installed version is 4.0.1.  Attempting to update results in error message: "Cannot install a lower version than the currently installed version."

Atlassian Marketplace also shows the lower version at the top of the version list. 

_NOTE: This issue is starting to trend as L1 tickets in GSAC._

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

!image-2019-05-01-14-42-44-787.png!

!image-2019-05-01-14-39-49-273.png!
fields.summary: Clicking on UPM Update results in "Cannot install a lower version than the currently installed version."

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When inputing a string value in a comment that contains a backslash "\" character before an "@" character the backslash is removed, this is impactful if attempting to input a file path as a comment where the file contains the @ character in the path exe: {code}\\127.0.0.1\path\to\file\@_in_pathname\example.txt{code} the \ before the @ is truncated

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud and Jira Server 8.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Type the following in a text field outside a code block and post, EXE: Comment on issue
{code}
\@
{code}

h3. Expected Results
comment displays 
{code}
\@
{code}

h3. Actual Results
comment displays only the "@" as the slash is truncated like the following which does include a backslash but will not render noting https://jira.atlassian.com is currently affected on 8.1.0:
 "\@"
 
h3. Notes
Does not affect other Special characters and seems to be limited to the backslash character speciffically "\", tested with:
{code}
` ~ ! # $ % ^ & * ( ) ; : ' " / . > , <
{code}
Text Entered:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-01 at 12.12.43 PM.png|thumbnail!  

h3.Workaround
Add the string value to a "code" macro or "noformat" macro and the backslash will not be removed
fields.summary: using backslash and At "\@" character in string input to comment is truncating the slash

fields.description:
Provide the ability for Jira administrators to customize the fields displayed in the *Issues in Epic* table on Epics.

In _Advanced Settings_, we can modify the columns to show when viewing sub-task issues in a table by modifying the *jira.table.cols.subtasks* setting.

We should be able to do this with the *Issues in Epic* table as well.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the Issues in Epic panel

This icon is also returned if i go to domain/favicon.ico. So my desktop browser gets stuck with old icon for bookmarks.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira does not offer methods to *bulk* edit avatars e.g. updates, deletions. For example, a method for an admin to set a default avatars for users meeting certain criteria.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow more options for admins to bulk change avatars rather than relying on individual changes, which are not scalable for large organizations.
fields.summary: Bulk Avatar Functions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently Jira doesn't provide a way to restrict or whitelist source IPs (JRASERVER-67452) for remote API interaction at all. One of the challenges of implementing a workaround for this at proxy/network environment level is that the REST API URL patterns for the public API are also often used by requests triggered from the UI. So there is a risk of blocking normal UI based requests while intending to block remote API calls.

h3. Suggested Solution
One way to constrain remote API usage to some extent may be to limit or restrict the use of basic auth for REST API. Provide facility or configuration to restrict basic authentication requests to whitelisted IPs.
fields.summary: Provide a way to whitelist IPs for REST API basic authentication

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

The time of a license to be expired is unpredictable. Some licenses might even expire a day earlier than the expected date. This is an issue similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66259
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
 # Generate a few evaluation licenses for Service Desk in different time zones.
 # Apply the evaluation license in Jira.
 # Change the server date to the expiry date of the evaluation license.
 # Adjust the server time to estimate the time that the evaluation license gets expired and cause https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3217. Note down the estimated time.
 # Repeat steps 2 - 4 with another any licenses.

h3. Expected result

The licenses stop working only on next day of the expiry date.
h3. Actual result

The licenses might expire a day earlier or any time on the expiry day.
fields.summary: The expiry date and time of an license is unpredictable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When importing issues with the External System Import -> JSON importer, if any of the fields in the exported JSON file contain Unicode characters (like in the table below) they will not display property in some environments after successful import:
||Unicode code point||UTF-8 (dec.)||name||
|U+2018|226 128 152|LEFT SINGLE QUOTATION MARK|
|U+2019|226 128 153|RIGHT SINGLE QUOTATION MARK|
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy the JSON attached in the next internal update
 # Change the following items:
 ** Project key (must be an existing project on JIRA instance)
 ** Status (must be valid for issue type)
 ** Reporter/Assignee (for ease of permissions to access)
 # Import the file using the External System Import -> JSON option

h3. Expected Results

In a few instances, the characters show up correctly in the Summary and Description fields:
 MySQL 5.7.19 - JIRA 7.12.3
 MSSQL 2017 - JIRA 7.12.3
 postgres 9.5 on 8.1
 postgres 9.5 on 7.8.1
h3. Actual Results

Most of the time, the characters show up incorrectly. This has been reproduced in:
 PostgreSQL 9.3 - JIRA 7.8.0
 PostgreSQL 9.3 - JIRA 7.12.3
 MSSQL 2012 on 7.8.1
 MSSQL 2014 on 7.8.1
 MSSQL 2016 on 7.9.2

(!) When looking at the value in the jiraissue table -> summary or description fields, the characters are stored *incorrectly* in the database. It would appear that the problem is either in the JSON importer or perhaps with some of the specific database versions where the behavior is exhibited.
h3. Workaround

Replace unicode characters with non-unicode characters where possible
fields.summary: Unicode Characters in JSON Import Display Incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When using operating system which shows no scrollbars by default (such newer macOS or Windows), as the scrollbar only appears when we hover to the attachments list, the last element should be shown as "cut off" so that users will know there are more than four entries. As the max-height of that menu is defined, this will show no indication that there are more entries at first sight. 

To fix this, we should set max-height to a height which ensures that the last element is shown "cut off" as a design affordance for "there is more below, just scroll to it"

The example can be seen from the attachments attached to this ticket.
fields.summary: When browsing for attachments using operating system which shows no scrollbars by default, the last element should be shown as "cut off" so that users will know there are more than four entries.
